reviews.review: Like the first Portal game, it great! Sometimes I found the story line confusing though. But, overall it a fantastic game!
The best puzzle game I've ever played.

This game is one of the best one's I'e played. it's funny, has a great main idea, has very well thought out puzzles. Just play the darn game man.

One of my all-time favorite games.

Single player:
It's very fun and just.. portal. I enjoy puzzle games in general, but the use of portals adds an entirely new depth to it. It really does make you think differently, hence "Thinking with portals". As the second game in this franchise, it really experiments with new ideas. With the addition of the excursion funnels, light bridges, the different gel types, etc, it adds all these brilliant things into game that I already loved. On top of the great mechanics and challenging puzzles that build the base for this game, there's just enough humor and story elements sprinkled in to make it a really unique experience.

Co-op:
The co-op is on an entirely different level. Now instead of 2 portals, you have to think with 4? And work together, resisting the urge to send your partner-in-science shooting into the pits below? Now that's a challenge. On a serious note, the co-op does require a lot of teamwork and thinking outside the box. Doing puzzles with 2 people, 2 portals each is much different than doing puzzles alone. The co-op built into the game is fantastic as is, but the community maps are something I can appreciate after originally playing this game on console. From the unique puzzle maps, to the gel racing maps, it reinstalled my love for this game with new content.

Ratings:
Gameplay       9
Enjoyment    10
Multiplayer     9
Replayability  5
Overall        9.5

Highly recommend

Si jugaste el primer portal y te gust√≥ lo que viste, preparate porque esta secuela deja a su antecesor como una demo de 3 horas. Toma el concepto tan original de puzzles con portales y lo expande en todos los sentidos, tanto en el gameplay, en su historia, en su apartado gr√°fico; en fin lo profundiza. Se nota como el equipo de desarrollo de Valve le pone su toque en muchos puntos del juego. 
Si tuviese que dar las razones de porque debes comprarlo y jugarlo, puedo resumirlo en que el juego est√° estructurado en una forma de afrontar la trama que me record√≥ mucho a los half-life, con detalles en todo momento. Desde el lado jugable, sigue utilizando portales de entrada y de salida, pero mientras avanza el juego a√±ade distintos tipos de implementos que juegan con la f√≠sica del entorno para resolver los puzzles (fluidos de hipervelocidad, de repulsi√≥n, campos gravitacionales, etc). 
Por fuera del modo historia, existe el apartado de mapas hechos por la comunidad que son una locura, la oportunidad de jugar en co-op tanto la historia como el modo comunidad, modos de desaf√≠o, y niveles agregados como citas de audios con conceptos del equipo de desarrollo mientras estaban organizando el juego.
Es un juego que me dej√≥ una gran sensaci√≥n al terminarlo, al igual que el primero. Es corto pero vale mucho la pena, muy recomendado!

Similar to the portal 1 experience, but longer and with co-op. It isn't stuck in the past, it adds new mechanics, and it retains the soul of the previous game. The single-player feels a bit lengthy, but you should definitely complete it nonetheless. Portal 1+2 are among the greatest games

This game is near perfect, it has pretty fun and creative puzzles, a lot of mechanics added throughout the game so it doesn't get boring, and also a pretty fun story / dialog. only fault I can see is that it might be a little too short but to compensate there is both a co-op campaign which is pretty good, and also workshop maps / extras for mroe content

I'm not gonna be one of those people that says 'just buy the game'. Instead here's an actual review for undecided people. A while back I watched a video reviewing a seperate game in which the reviewer said they knew while playing that they were making memories. And that at some unkown later date would look back at that point in time. They said 'can you really put a price on memories?'. I'm not gonna describe the game to you, instead Ill leave you with this: buy it, it's 10 bucks, set a timer for an hour and 50 minutes, if time feels like it flew to that point than your gonna like portal, and as I know that everything does not appeal to everyone just because its a good game, if the timer goes off and your bored out of your mind, quit the game and refund it. 

In terms of length I managed to finish the game in 6 and a half hours, however I have heard that aside from speedrunners that is on the fast side of things. Also if your going to buy portal 2 spend the extra 5 bucks and get the bundle with the original portal as well.
One of the best puzzle games, with the best plot I ever played. Also, one of the few games I've completed!
